titleStmt.title: Before I got my eye put out

publicationStmt.p: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998

lg.l: Before I got my eye put out -
I liked as well to see
As other creatures, that have eyes -
And know no other way -
But were it told to me, Today,
That I might have the Sky

For mine, I tell you that my
Heart
Would split, for size of me -
The Meadows - mine -
The Mountains - mine -
All Forests - Stintless stars -

As much of noon, as I could
take -
Between my finite eyes -
The Motions of the Dipping Birds -
The Lightning's jointed Road -

For mine - to look at when
I liked,

The news would strike me
dead -

So safer - guess - with just
my soul
Opon the window pane

Where other creatures put
their eyes -
Incautious - of the Sun -
